intro: Phlegmariurus sphagnicola, commonly known as the bog moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a small, mat-forming plant that thrives in moist, acidic environments such as bogs and peatlands. The plant has a thalloid structure with a prostrate stem covered in leaf-like structures called phyllidia. It reproduces via spores, which are released from specialized capsules that develop on the stems. This species plays an important ecological role in nutrient cycling and soil stabilization in its habitat.
